issues.title: React Component Has Mild Complexity in Dependencies
issues.description: The fetchData callback includes selectedRunId in its dependency array, creating a circular relationship that adds mental overhead. The conditional check prevents infinite loops but is fragile.
issues.suggestion: Split into two separate effects or add a comment explaining why the dependency is safe.

issues.title: Test Coverage Might Be Overdoing It
issues.description: 9 tests for relatively simple UI behavior. Some tests check implementation details (CSS classes, truncation logic) rather than user behavior, which makes them brittle.
issues.suggestion: Monitor for test brittleness. If tests start failing frequently due to UI refactors, consolidate them.

positive_observations: Backend filter is perfectly minimal (simple SQL WHERE clause)
No premature optimization (no pagination, caching, or infinite scroll)
No dead code - every line added is used
Frontend reuses existing components instead of duplicating
summary: Well-scoped PR with minimal backend changes and focused frontend implementation. Minor code smell in React dependency management, but nothing blocking. Recommend approval after addressing D1.
